channel.title: Runserver.bat
channel.description:
Hi, at the moment, I can't portforward with my router, because I'm having problems connecting to my portforwarding page.
I'm going to let a trusted mod on my server(before it shut down) to host the server.
Is there a way to make runserver.bat seperate from the server files, but still be able to run the server? (I'm password locking the files)
All help is appreciated. Thanks.

item.title: Runserver.bat
item.dc:creator: @Graham Graham
item.description:
@Graham wrote:

You can’t in that case. You need to give them all the files.

Read full topic

item.title: Runserver.bat
item.dc:creator: @kiwon kiwon
item.description:
@kiwon wrote:

I know I can do that, but my character files are already present. My server shut down, due to my router having some problems, and until i get it fixed, I need somebody to host it. I don’t want the hoster to mess around with the character files, the ban files, and the other stuff.

Read full topic

item.title: Runserver.bat
item.dc:creator: @Graham Graham
item.description:
@Graham wrote:

[quote=“kiwon, post:1, topic:195428”]Hi, at the moment, I can’t portforward with my router, because I’m having problems connecting to my portforwarding page.

I’m going to let a trusted mod on my server(before it shut down) to host the server.

Is there a way to make runserver.bat seperate from the server files, but still be able to run the server? (I’m password locking the files)

All help is appreciated. Thanks.[/quote]

You would probably want to just include the *.class files (compiled bytecode), the run server batch file and your data/account files. However, people can still decompile and steal passwords so remember to be careful.

Read full topic
